column1: Known for their innovative CPAP masks and advanced sleep therapy technology, ResMed has released the bilevel machines in their S9 VPAP product line. The S9 VPAP series combines the sleek design of the popular ResMed S9 machines with the advanced technology and features of the VPAP bilevel devices to create a machine that delivers more to you than any other bilevel machine available.

The ResMed S9 VPAP Auto Bilevel machine delivers two treatment pressures, an inspiratory and expiratory pressure, for treatment of different forms of sleep apnea and other respiratory disorders. This auto bilevel adjusts both the pressure on inhalation and the pressure on exhalation automatically, ensuring that you receive the correct level of therapy throughout the night. An improvement over the S8 VPAP Auto, the ResMed S9 VPAP Auto includes the Enhanced Easy-Breathe Technology to increase the comfort level of your therapy.

The S9 VPAP Auto Bilevel also includes many other features that make sleep therapy more comfortable and convenient for you. The patented Climate Control humidification system is available with the fully integrated H5i humidifier and patented ClimateLine Heated Tubing that protects from rainout or less-than-optimal humidity levels (both included with this model). Climate Control automatically determines the best water temperature to maintain high humidity levels in the air you breathe in through the night. Optional wireless therapy monitoring, optional integrated pulse oximetry, a therapy measurement called Sleep Quality Indicator, the quietest motor available, and advanced data recording all combine in the sleek and easy-to-use S9 body to create one of the most intelligent bilevel devices on the market today. The ResMed S9 VPAP Auto Bilevel is clearly one of the best-in-class devices available.

column1: Known for their innovative CPAP masks and advanced sleep therapy technology, ResMed has released the bilevel machines in their S9 VPAP product line. The ResMed S9 VPAP Auto Bilevel machine delivers two treatment pressures, an inspiratory and expiratory pressure, for treatment of different forms of sleep apnea and other respiratory disorders.
